meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose confidence or hope.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism from his boss was demoralizing for him.
meanings.sent2: The defeat in the final match was demoralizing for the team.
meanings.sent3: The demoralizing effect of the rainy weather made everyone feel gloomy.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was demoralizing, draining their spirits.
meanings.sent5: The lack of progress in the project was truly demoralizing for the team members.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) feel less brave or confident.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie was demoralizing for the young children.
meanings.sent2: The failure of the experiment was demoralizing for the scientist.
meanings.sent3: The demoralizing sight of the spider made her scream and run away.
meanings.sent4: The steep climb ahead seemed demoralizing, but they pushed on.
meanings.sent5: The demoralizing feedback from the teacher made him doubt his abilities.
